title: I am not certain why Riot puts true damage on every champion now...
body:
But between all the true damage and %HP shred they give to everyone, it is only making it harder on themselves to balance tanking items. If they make it so x champion deals true damage and y champion deals % HP damage then tank items still have to be valid against those champions, making those tank items and masteries much stronger vs anybody who cannot get enough penetration/%shred and doesn't have it in their kit.

Adding tons of uncounterable damage is only asking for a balance nightmare.

When Garen does 1800 true damage instantaneously to me when I'm supposed to be a tank, and literally negates my entire kit's purpose when it comes to sustaining vs damage... 

There's a problem... 

Also, anyone who can inflict both %HP damage and True damage is more or less impossible to build defenses against. If you build more HP, they do more damage. If you build more resistances, then you're not protected against their damage. True damage coupled with %HP damage motivates me to just build a pure damage/lifesteal/spell vamp build. Life steal is probably the only answer to such a situation, except in instances where the true damage comes at you instantly in a massive burst. (See: Garen) 

If you're forced to stack HP to protect against true damage, now you're lacking resistances vs the %HP damage that's coming your way. It's a build optimization nightmare.

> 1800 true damage instantaneously to me when I'm supposed to be a tank, and literally negates my entire kit's purpose when it comes to sustaining vs damage...
There's a problem...

Dude, this only happens when A: You're the villain, and B: You're low health. Stop looking at the large numbers. Most of it is purposely overkill to make sure that it's an execute.

%HP damage is almost always done in a manner that can be itemized against.

Example: {{item:3153}} Buy Armor. The %HP damage is physical, so it's lessened by armor. 

As for optimization, just buy a balance. Buy Armor for Physical, MR for Magic, and True damage is pretty much taken care of as the MR and Armor items you bought stack health.

People keep saying that Camille turns on-hits into true damage.

That means that Botrk does true damage on Camille. 

I know it isn't constant, but it's there. Also, when I've got 2400 HP as a tank and Garen does 1800+ true damage to me, I wasn't low HP, I got hit by maybe 2 autos from another enemy champ, and maybe took some AoE damage, now I'm dead from a point and click ability that inflicts nearly my entire HP bar in damage. My champion is supposed to sustain through damage in long fights, and I know that burst is a huge counter to sustain, but when there's no way I can itemize against that damage except by building my champion incorrectly (meaning I'm now less effective vs the other 4 enemy champions), or I just have to play a different champion, (which isn't always a choice if I picked before Garen was picked)... 

I just want a way to play against it. As a tanky champion with low mobility, I can't kite Garen, and even if I had a champion that is strong at kiting, Garen does have his Q, and his ult has a bit of range. 

I don't think these things are overpowered, but it just makes it more or less impossible to build defensively against. I can't pick up a warmog's just because they have a Garen, when two other champs on their team inflict %HP damage, and now I can't build resistances, because one of those %HP damage champions does true damage on top of the true damage that Garen has. 

I understand that the point of true damage is for it to be "true" damage, but there's rarely effective counterplay besides just killing or cc'ing the other person. Like I said, lifesteal is probably the only true counter to a %hp and true damage mix. You can go with a low HP pool and maybe build an item like Tmail or Banshee's to protect against the %hp damage, and then at the same time you'll sustain through their true damage. (their non true damage isn't effective against you, and you're healing for hopefully more than their true damage). 

Although, like I said before, when Garen can 80-0 me with the click of a button... I should just split push 100% of the time and avoid fighting altogether.

This is just a straight up lie. Here, I'll even do the math for you to prove it.

Garen ult does 525 + 40% missing hp damage at max rank. For you to have taken 1800 damage, 1800 - 525 = 1275 damage needs to have come from the 40% missing hp portion.

40% x 2.5 = 100%
1275 x 2.5 = 3187.5

So you'd need to be missing over 3k hp for the missing hp portion of Garen's ult to do that much damage, which you obviously couldn't be if your max hp was 2400.

Let me begin by saying I agree with you. However, there  _is_ a reason for it and I'll attempt to give it:

The champions being given %HP/true dmg currently are mostly melee champions (I don't think that {{champion:202}}  really needs it, and {{champion:203}}  sort of depends on it).

The reason they are giving melee champions %HP/true damage is to discourage squishy/damage champions from buying tank items. There is nothing preventing carries from buying defensive items, and indeed this was very common pre-S4. 

This being said, Riot IS giving pretty much EVERY melee dmg champion %HP/true dmg. 

Take the last 10 champions released:
